chargeHist.descr: Sex with Child Age 16 or Older
Sex with Child Age 16 or Older

result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary J Norton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.
  • Intent. Contribute/Delinquency Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).
  • Intent. Contribute/Delinquency Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Apply 56 days sentence credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Sex Offender Treatment and follow through.
No unsupervised contact with any minor females.
Compliance with the sex offender registry for the period of probation - ONLY.
No contact with the victim (listed in the criminal complaint), family members or residence.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Restitution to be determined.

AMENDED 08-11-2016:  Court orders restitution in the amount of $6,606.00 to be paid to the victim's parents (G. P.).  Restitution is to be paid as a Condition of Probation and to be paid BEFORE costs/fines.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all Standard Release Conditions.
FIRST 45 DAYS TO BE SERVED THROUGH HUBER, commencing forthwith.
LAST 45 DAYS ARE STAYED.  To be used at Agent's discretion.

AMENDED 08-11-2016:  The Court lifts the stay on the 45 days of Condition Time.

Defendant Zachary J Norton in court with Attorney Eryn M Menden.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin, as well as Assistant Corporation Counsel Christopher Morgan.  Attorney Menden requests an adjournment regarding restitution as she was just given restitution figures/information today in court.  Attorney Menden makes statements regarding bail forfeiture, asks that forfeiture be set aside.  Asst Corporation Counsel Morgan requests that bail forfeiture remain in place.  Court finds that bail forfeiture was appropriate, however modifies to $500.00 - ordering $500.00 only to be forfeited.  Attorney Menden addresses sex offender registry issue, requests that Defendant be able to be removed from sex offender registry pending appeal.  State objects to request.  Court denies request for Defendant to be removed from sex offender registry pending appeal.  Court sets restitution hearing.  Restitution hearing scheduled for August 5, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Court orders the following:
Count 1:
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail - Staight-time.
56 Days Credit.
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  3 Years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Sex offender treatment and follow through.
No unsupervised contact with any minor females.
Compliance with the sex offender registry for the period of probation ONLY.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ;

Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  victim ( listed in the criminal complaint) any family members or residence.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Sucharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

90 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).

Last 45 Days - STAYED - To be used at agent's discretion.
